name: Hawaiian Dream Cookies
description: These cookies are lovely as they are, but I'll sometimes use a light-colored sanding sugar for the top: First, lightly brush the top cookie with cream, then sprinkle with sanding sugar. This can be done before or after placing the cookie on top of the filling. —Lorraine Caland, Shuniah, Ontario

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, cream shortening, butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs, vanilla and lemon zest. In another bowl, whisk flour, baking powder and salt; gradually beat into creamed mixture. Divide dough in half. Shape each into a disk; wrap in plastic. Refrigerate 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 350°. On a surface sprinkled with confectioners' sugar, roll dough to 1/4-in. thickness. Cut with a 2-in. round cookie cutter dusted with confectioners' sugar. Using a floured 1-in. star-shaped cookie cutter, cut out the centers of half of the cookies; re-roll scraps as needed. Place solid and window cookies 2 in. apart on greased baking sheets. Repeat with remaining dough.
Bake 12-15 minutes or until edges are brown. Cool on pans 5 minutes. Remove to wire racks to cool completely.

In a small saucepan, mix sugar and cornstarch. Stir in pineapple. Cook and stir over medium heat until thickened. Stir in butter. Cool completely. Spread filling on bottoms of solid cookies; top with window cookies. Dust with confectioners' sugar.

review.reviewBody: Sorry guys, this recipe had hopes of being yummy & look pretty.  Unfortunately, the taste is way too sweet & the stars in the middle rose with the dough while baking & we’re almost closed up. The filling was great on it’s own, however in the cookie sandwich, was much too runny.  I get angry with those folks that rate the recipe one star after changing the recipe.  I just want you to know I was faithful to the recipe & it was a dud.  Oh yes, after all the work of making them, was disappointed it didn’t make more.  But - should have read all the way to the end.
So light and delicious! I'm making these again, only doubling up on the recipe! Yum!
